# Notes

1. If in `Analyte Concentration Troublesh` tab, the calibration_curve_range_category == `<LOD`, set analyte_concentration_ng = NF
2. Bring through calibration_curve_range_category to subsequent tabs in Analyze File 2
3. If in `Analyte Concentration Troublesh` tab, the calibration_curve_range_category == `<LOQ`, set analyte_concentration_ng = `<LOQ`
4. Output Wide File: Only carry concentrations to fall `Within Calibration Range` or `Above Calibration Range`
5. New Tab - "Eval Blank Fltring":
  a. batch_number
  b. cartridge_number
  c. individual_native_analyte_name
  d. calibration_curve_range_category
  e. analyte_concentration_ng
  f. average_extraction_blank_analyte_concentration_ng (See file 1_BuildExtractionBlank.R)
  g. field_blank_average_analyte_concentration_ng (See 3_2_RemoveFieldBlanksFromBlankFiltering.R)
